artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Jesus on cross with halo and Inri sign over head; flanked by two others on crosses; crowd with daggers standing in front of Jesus
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate at bottom: [Betweene twoo Theeves Christ Crucified you see / The left hand theefe\'s a Monke, the Souldiers bee / Friers, Bishops, monkes, who fight with bookes and staves / And for his Coate throw Dice like Cheating knaves.]

numbered in plate at lower right: [13]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Crucifixion, From the Satirical Passion
